Trails.Name: Lost in the Woods (Lower) Uphill Route
Lost in the Woods (Upper) Uphill Route

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Thursday, February 12, 2026 6:00 AM The storm is clearing out this morning, leaving us with a crisp and calm day on the mountain. The winds have dropped off significantly, giving us a great window to enjoy the fresh snow. We are operating under storm cycle operational procedures, so we have a delayed opening of no earlier than 9AM. Our operations teams teams are working hard to get things open this morning, so please be patient with rolling openings. It is definitely on the colder side today, which is great news for the snow quality, but make sure to bundle up. We have 19 lifts on the schedule to get you out on the hill.
 
Conditions and Visibility: Powder and packed powder conditions. Visibility is improving with a mix of sun and clouds as the storm clears.
Lift status: 19 lifts are expected to operate. Opening is delayed until at least 9AM.
Safety: Deep Snow Safety. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) remains real. Avoid tree wells and deep pockets of snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner and keep them in sight. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Roads are snow-packed and icy from the storm. Drive with caution. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: Deep Snow Safety. With significant accumulation expected, the risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real. Avoid tree wells and deep pockets of snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner and keep them in sight.
